intro: Chiococca barbigera, commonly known as the velvetleaf chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Chiococca barbigera is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
